message.content:
Here's the ranking of the candidates from most suitable to least suitable based on the provided mortgage loan criteria:

1. Valon Morina (Rank #1)

   - Permanent employment at Google
   - No debt collection cases
   - Domestic/partnered household

2. Vjollca Bajrami (Rank #2)
   - Strong 2nd pillar balance (70,000 CHF)
   - Permanent employment at Swiss Red Cross
   - No debt collection cases

3. Diana Costa (Rank #3)
   - Permanent employment at Stadler Rail AG
   - Balanced own funds distribution
   - Domestic/partnered household

4. José Pereira (Rank #4)
   - Permanent employment at prestigious architectural firm
   - Balanced own funds
   - Domestic/partnered household

5. Aleksandar Ilić (Rank #5)
   - Permanent employment at Swiss Post
   - Balanced own funds
   - Domestic/partnered household

6. Ana Lopez (Rank #6)
   - Permanent employment at engineering firm
   - Moderate own funds
   - Domestic/partnered household

7. Danijela Živković (Rank #7)
   - Permanent employment at bank
   - Moderate own funds
   - Single status

8. Carlos Gonzalez (Rank #8)
   - Permanent employment at KPMG
   - Moderate own funds
   - Single status

9. Martin Schneider (Rank #9)
   - Permanent employment in IT
   - Moderate own funds
   - Domestic/partnered household

10. Meryem Yıldız (Rank #10)
    - Permanent employment as pharmacist
    - Moderate own funds
    - Single status

11. Mehmet Özdemir (Rank #11)
    - Federal government employment
    - Slightly lower own funds
    - Single status

12. Monika Weber (Rank #12)
    - Lowest Pillar 3a balance
    - Domestic/partnere

context.systems_message:

- Purchase Price incl. Planned Investments: 1'090'000 CHF
- Own Funds: 218'000 CHF

- Fixed-Rate Mortgage Online, 5 Years: 218'000, 1.390%
- Fixed-Rate Mortgage Online, 10 Years: 436'000, 1.740%
